fullDescription.intro:
Extends a relation (table) by adding a single attribute (column) of a specified value and type. This operation goes beyond first order Relational Algebra to allow new values to be created.
The value of the column is defined by an arbitrary expression, which must be of the specified type. See the Jexl documentation for details.
All columns are available to use as variables in an expression, provided the column name is a Jexl simple identifier.
fullDescription.option: Specify the name of the column to be added..
Select the data type for the new column.
The expression to be evaluated, written in JEXL expression language.
